{"step_by_step_thinking": "The muscles of mastication are primarily supplied by the maxillary artery, which is a branch of the external carotid artery. The maxillary artery has three parts: the first (mandibular), second (pterygoid), and third (pterygopalatine). The muscles of mastication are supplied by the deep branches of the second part of the maxillary artery.", "answer_choice": "A"}
